citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
- The licensee is using small containers of fly bait placed on top of nest boxes. He was unable to identify the specific
compound being used, so it is unclear if this product is safe to use around birds. Regardless of the product, placing bins
of the fly bait on top of bird housing is a potential source of contamination to the enclosed animals. Fly bait should be
approved by the attending veterinarian, or be safe for birds and used per manufacturer recommendations. The licensee
must identify the specific product being used and make sure that it is appropriate, or approved by the attending
veterinarian. Licensee corrected the issue at the time of inspection by moving the containers to a safe location that does
not potentially contaminate the birds.
Corrected at the time of inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
3.158(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
- The licensee is using small containers of fly bait placed on top of nest boxes. He was unable to identify the specific 
compound being used, so it is unclear if this product is safe to use around birds. Regardless of the product, placing bins 
of the fly bait on top of bird housing is a potential source of contamination to the enclosed animals. Fly bait should be 
approved by the attending veterinarian, or be safe for birds and used per manufacturer recommendations. The licensee 
must identify the specific product being used and make sure that it is appropriate, or approved by the attending 
veterinarian. Licensee corrected the issue at the time of inspection by moving the containers to a safe location that does 
not potentially contaminate the birds. 
Corrected at the time of inspection 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
